casebody.data:
John Halliday versus John Doggett et al. June 26 The plaintiff, being a "partner of a manufacturing house in Scotland and their agent for exporting goods to this country, consigned certain carpets to a commission merchant in Boston, by whom they were sold to the defendants ; and this action was brought to recover the price. The Court, under the general issue, now ordered a nonsuit on account of the -non-joinder of the other owners of the goods, observing that the action should have been in the names of all the owners, or m that of the agent who made the contract.1 Sullivan, for the plaintiff,

cited 1 Saund. 154, 291f; Rice v. Shute, 5 Burr. 2611 ; Sargent v. Morris, 3 Barn. & Aid. 280

; Skinner v. Stocks, 4 Barn. & Aid. 437

Curtis, for the defendants.

See Collyer on Partn. 390.
